name: Adrienne Young
bio: New York Times & International Bestselling Author • The Unmaking of June Farrow • Spells For Forgetting • Fable Series • Sky & Sea 🖤

social_posts.post_text: This launch week has been a dream filled with moments 10-Years-Ago Adrienne never would have believed. Bestseller lists & accolades & starred reviews & book deal announcements are nothing to seeing readers fall into a world you’ve built & not then refuse to leave. I am so, so amazed to see SAINT at the top of this stack, a character born in my imagination but summoned to life by the demand of readers who love him & Isolde. 🖤

The last couple of stops on the SAINT tour are underway, but it’s just one week until THE STORYTELLER’S WORKBOOK heads out into the world! We’ve had quite a few requests for personalized copies, so we are offering them through @bookmarksnc & we’ll be heading there Friday to sign them. If you want one, the link is under “Signed Copies” in my profile! 🖤

A piece of my heart will always live in the Narrows & you’re welcome to come visit anytime. Somewhere along the way this year, I became one of those people who doesn’t take pictures of anything! Thus, I have very little documented proof that I ever went on tour for the release of Saint but suffice it to say that it was one of the most wonderful weeks of my career yet. Thank you to @bookmarksnc @booksandbooks @andersonsbookshop @stlouiscountylibrary @keplersbooks @powellsbooks & @bnnorthgate for hosting me, @authoradalyngrace @rstrolle @avasreid @lainit & @timesnewrachel for being in conversation, & of course, my heart is bursting with love & gratitude for the readers who have gone on this journey into the Narrows with me. I will truly never be able to express how much it has meant to me. Thank you to everyone who has supported this series (including my agent @bpoelle , editor @e_roths & the whole team at @wednesdaybooks ) This experience has been so special & this book is the manifestation of the mystical connection that exists between the storyteller & the reader. We are bound together in such a lovely, strange way. I’m believing the story isn’t over, but until we return to the Narrows, there’s a lot more in store. 🖤

It’s here! The Storyteller’s Workbook is out today, ready for you to fill it’s pages with the story only you can write. I’m so looking forward to seeing how writers use it & imagining all the secrets each one will hold. This isn’t a craft book or set of strict lessons. It doesn’t matter your skill level or process, the workbook is a storyteller’s playground. You make the rules. Happy writing! 🖤

The last newsletter of 2022 goes out on Friday & inside it juuuuust might have the title & description of my next book, another adult novel, coming out in 2023! The newsletter goes out every other month & it has an author update, book & music recs, writing resources, my favorite things, & more. Newsletter folks also get first dibs on most of the big news that happens around here. Link is in my profile to subscribe. 🖤

Winter Solstice
Longest night
Darkness fills the soul
With sight 🖤

I try to reflect on lessons at the end of the year & this week I’ve been meditating a lot on how people keep surprising me. In all directions. There are those who have hurt me, who I have harshly judged & somehow they come back & surprise me. There are those who I think I can count on, who I think can do no wrong, who have been idolized & praised. They have surprised me. Those I think I know, who I think cannot & never will change or those I think I’ll never find common ground with, & yet… I stand corrected. I have even surprised myself, been disappointed in myself. There are those who’ve underestimated me only to be proven wrong. Those who have put me on a pedestal only to see me fall down & on & on we go. I think this truth brings me hope? Yes, I’m almost certain it does. 🖤

Hi. Remember me? ☺️ I’m climbing out of my little cave on Monday to post something very lovely & exciting & I’ll be wading back into the IG space as my official start to the year. Yes, that’s right. 2023 is only just beginning for me. 🤣 I’ll give you all the updates next week. 🖤

At long last, the book I’ve been lovingly referring to as Red Door has a title, a cover, & is up for preorder (link in profile) everywhere! I cannot overstate how excited about this book I am. I can’t wait to share it with you. 🖤

In the small mountain town of Jasper, North Carolina, June Farrow is waiting for fate to find her. The Farrow women are known for their thriving flower farm—and the mysterious curse that has plagued their family line for as long as anyone can remember. But June is determined to be the last of her name, and in turn, be first Farrow to never find love. The whole town knows of the madness that led to Susanna Farrow’s disappearance, leaving her daughter, June, to be raised by her grandmother and haunted by rumors. Everyone in Jasper is certain that it's only a matter of time before she finds the same end, but June hasn't told a single soul that it's already begun. 

After her grandmother’s death, a series of clues linking her mother's disappearance to the town's grim past emerge, leading June to a mysterious door. Behind it may lay the answer to the mysteries that have always lingered like a dark shadow over Jasper and the Farrows, but the further into the unknown she goes, the more her mind seems to unravel. Upon crossing the threshold, June embarks on a journey that will not only change both the past and the future, but entangle her fate and her heart in a star-crossed love.

Last week at the @reesesbookclub #litupretreat I finally got to meet @reesewitherspoon & although I blubbered on her a bit, it was such a timely connection.  I am so inspired by what she’s built & women like her spur me on & keep me focused on my own path, which is honestly really hard sometimes. 🫠 I’ve been honored to serve as a mentor for LitUp this year & am ready to see its impact (& the impact of so many other amazing initiatives!) on representation in publishing. Also, my mentee @allisonkingwrites book is so incredible & I feel so special that I’ve been able to read it before the world does. 🖤

Just wrapped the third Storyteller’s Retreat. Still not sure how I get to write books & hang out with writers for a living, but I’ll take it. Writing With the Soul has grown & stretched into something that is [insert word that doesn’t exist in any language] & I’m very grateful for my small but mighty team (thank you @ladyofbookshire & @mercedes.langdon !) who make it possible for me to bring these sparkling visions to life. I have some pretty wide eyed dreams for the future that include MANY more books, venturing into new realms of storytelling, & some big, beautiful things for the evolution Writing With the Soul. I’m very, very excited. 🖤

Just returned from a week in Texas with my family—days filled with all the things that make it feel like my first home—bonfires, bourbon, country music, never ending fields dotted with hay bales, bbq, black tar roads, birthdays, brick houses, so much laughter that my face ached with it, bluebonnets & Indian paintbrush, living room jam sessions, tacos, big blue skies, june bugs… the list goes on. But my favorite moment this trip was when I found myself standing alone in the kitchen at “the Alba house” & taking my Papa’s hat off the hook where it hangs to set it on my head for just one quiet minute. For all those years that I never really felt I fit, that I dreamed of life elsewhere, there are things about Texas that still live in my bones. 🖤

The Spanish edition of Spells for Forgetting is out & it’s one of my favorite covers I’ve ever had. Thank you @umbrieleditores & @leonelteti for doing such an amazing job on this book & for sticking with me from the very beginning to bring my books to Spanish speaking readers. 🖤
Tomorrow I have a surprise for you concerning a certain little novella that has been the subject of many DMs & emails over the last two years & a promise I made… 🖤

In 2021 I surprised my newsletter subscribers with TIDES, a novella following the origins of Paj & Auster’s love story that also took readers into the home & life of the Roth’s. I wrote the first draft of the novella in two & a half days, feverishly swept away by the story & its characters. It’s still one of the most enjoyable writing experiences I can remember because it was the first time I realized just how obsessed with this world I truly was & how I could go on exploring it & it’s characters forever & ever. Now, TIDES is going out into the world in a really fun way. On August 1st, it will hit shelves *inside* THE LAST LEGACY paperback! I think it’s so fitting that the story would be published alongside Legacy & if you’ve already read them both, you know why. I’m very happy to finally give anyone who has been waiting to get their hands on this novella their chance to read it & keep it on their shelf. It won’t be the only Narrows world novella you’ll get before all is said & done. 🤫 The paperback of Legacy is now up for preorder via the link in my profile & come August, you can go back in time with the Roth’s. 🖤

Newsletter goes out TONIGHT. ✨ It includes all the goodies: music, books, updates, news, writerly resources, favorite things & even… a sneaky peek at TIDES for those of you who have yet to angst over Paj & Auster! The newsletter goes out every other month, & subscribers are first in line for pretty much anything & everything around here. Link to subscribe is in my profile. 🖤

I. Contain. Multitudes.

Five years ago today, Sky in the Deep, my darling Sky, was published. One summer day in California, after multiple failed attempts to get published, I was driving in a rare rainstorm when a song came on that changed my entire life. I was in the middle of enormous personal transformation at the time, & looking back, I think it may have been the reason that was the moment. Through writing Sky in the Deep, I figured out what I *really* wanted to write about. As depressing as it sounds, I learned that my work is very much about pain & fear, two things that not only make us very human, but connect us all. 

Never in my wildest dreams would I have imagined that five years later, I’d be here. Believe it or not, there are quite a few editions missing from this stack! Thank you to the readers all over the world who have opened the cover of one of my books & to my agent & my editors, who decided to invest in my work so that I could bring it into the world. I still have a lot left to do & when I’m a 78 year old hedge witch living in a cottage on a loch in Scotland, I hope to have only one regret—that my life won’t be long enough to tell all the stories living inside of me. 🖤

🎵 To the Hills by LAUREL

I’ve been at the cabin for the last few days on a solo writing retreat, getting lost in a story that makes my heart 🥁. I feel like I am getting back in touch with the knowledge of just how much my soul needs quiet & rest in order to hear my inner voice. I think I shared that I had a really rocky winter with my creativity & overall work process, but things are finally flowing again (thank you eclipse 💫) & I’m getting back in touch with that butterflies-in-my-stomach feeling. 🖤

Hi. If you’re new here, my name is Adrienne. I’m a teller of tales, a builder of worlds, a weaver of words. I’m an entrepreneur, a vision caster, & a mother of dragons. I write books about human nature & complicated relationships. I grew up in Texas, made a family in California & then planted it in the mountains of Western North Carolina. I love to be outside. I love to cook. I’m very, very bad at math. I don’t like crowds or chocolate cake, & reality tv stresses me out. I don’t really say things I don’t mean. I like the quiet. I prefer just a few friends curled up in front of a fire. I’m very introverted, & honestly pretty shy even though people don’t think so. I ask a lot of questions. I’m a driven dreamer, but I’m afraid of failure. I’m an over-thinker, a deep, deep feeler. I’m an HSP. I’m obsessed with story—truly obsessed. It colors everything I see in the world & my head is always, always spinning with it. The way to my heart is Indian food & good coffee. I’m the founder of Writing With the Soul, a workshop-turned-collective of writers that span the entire world. I’ve lived with anxiety for most, if not all, of my life. I draw my inspiration from music & history & atmospheres. I’m a good communicator, but have learned I don’t have to communicate everything. I’ve always been hard on myself, but I’m working on it. I’m imperfect, but I’m growing. I don’t cope well when things don’t go to plan. But I love very hard & I make a kick ass gin martini, so my people keep me. I genuinely believe that we are all connected—human, creature, plant, mountain, sea. I’m working on a lot of cool things right now & I feel so grateful that this is my work in the world. My next book comes out October 17th. That’s pretty much everything you need to know. Nice to meet you. 🖤
I have something secret coming for you on Monday. Hint: MANY of you have asked for this. Stay tuned. 🖤

Alright folks, here she is! Extremely excited to let you know that the number one requested novella from The Narrows world is officially headed your way! Drift follows the story of Willa and Koy after the events of Namesake, as they begin the grueling work of launching Jeval as a legitimate port city on the edge waters of The Narrows. This novella is an ebook, which means you can get it on all your e-reader devices & apps when it releases September 5! The story was so fun to write, & you’ll see appearances from characters all the way from Fable to The Last Legacy, one of whom might really surprise you. 🥰 You can read the description below & the link to pre-order is in my profile! 🌊 
•
After leaving the only family she's ever had on the Marigold, Willa has made a new start on a remote island carving out her own stake in the future of the Narrows. She's found an unexpected business partner in Koy and whether she likes it or not, they are suited in more ways than one. Together they plan to turn Jeval into the farthest reaching port before the waters of the Unnamed Sea. But when a ship docking in their newly minted harbor brings unsettling news that could mean trouble for the Narrows, Willa's determination to walk a path apart from her brother West will be tested. The more serious the situation gets, the more she's forced to rely on Koy, and she discovers that he's more than an opportunity to create her own destiny. He also just might be the safest harbor she's ever known. 🖤

Home from an incredible book tour in South America & I don’t have the words! I met so many readers, many of whom have been reading my books since SKY was first published in Spanish & I will never not be amazed at the amazing connection that stories have the power to make between people. I also have to say that I consider it a true gift to have @pucklatam @umbrieleditores as a partner in bringing my books to Spanish speaking readers. What a special, innovative & dedicated team! Thank you @leonelteti & @georgid016 for an unforgettable experience. 🖤

Ask & you shall receive! I’ve gotten many requests for signed copies of the Legacy + Tides paperback coming out in August & @bookmarksnc has graciously agreed to host them! I’ll also be including a print of the Paj & Auster art (swipe to 👀) with every signed copy. 🥰 Link in profile to order! 🖤

Welcome to Black Heart Society! I’m launching something brand new here on my IG. This summer I’m working on revisions for my next YA, but I’ll also be starting the story development phase of a new book & I’m going to be chronicling the entire process from the initial idea all the way to holding the printed book in my hands.

If you’re not yet familiar with Instagram Subscriptions, it’s the same basic idea as a Patreon or a Substack. Anyone who subscribes can see & access the exclusive content created just for the subscription. I’m a member of a few subscriptions from my favorite people to follow and I really love them!

If you’ve been around here for a while, you might already know where this project got its name. Lovingly named for the 🖤 that has been quintessential for me in this space, Black Heart Society is a peek over my shoulder as I navigate the unpredictable waters of writing.

Don’t worry, nothing about my IG space will change. It will be business as usual here, but I created BHS for readers, writers & creatives who want to set off on a journey to see the behind the scenes of making a book, the unfiltered mayhem of author life, & snag a few fun things along the way. 

If you want to join, you can tap the Subscribe button on my profile. 🖤
Week in review: Taking leaps of faith • The 🫘 adventures • Frenemy fur babes • A new office for summer • Happy tears • Sunset mountain views. 🖤
THE UNMAKING OF JUNE FARROW preorder campaign & signed copy details coming tomorrow. 🖤

The preorder campaign for The Unmaking of June Farrow is here! We’ve partnered again with @bookmarksnc & readers who preorder a signed copy from them will get the preorder gift—a packet of wildflower seeds from Adaline a river Flower Farm in Jasper, North Carolina, the home of the Farrows. 🥰 (while supplies last) Signed copies of Spells for Forgetting are also available. Be sure to read the instructions for personalizations before you order. Thank you for supporting with book with a preorder & in turn supporting the incredible work Bookmarks does to support literacy, representation in literature & the literary arts in North Carolina! Link in profile to preorder. 🖤
Newsletter goes out tomorrow! Author update, music & book recs, news, favorite things & other goodies will be hitting your inbox. Link to subscribe is in my profile! 🖤

Day in the Life! A glimpse at what a most work days look like for me as a full time author & mother of dragons. I get ask what a typical day looks like for me all the time & while having four kids absolutely throws significant curveballs into the mix on a regular basis, this routine serves as the structure of the mayhem. 🖤

Both Fable & Namesake are now out in France & French readers have been so welcoming to the Marigold & her crew. This story just keeps sailing across the world & every time I see it in a new language, my heart wants to burst. 🖤

Back to Scotland I go. 🏴󠁧󠁢󠁳󠁣󠁴󠁿 Headed back to my favorite place this fall, & while I’m there, I’ll be joining several other authors for an event at @toppingsedin in Edinburgh! If you’re in the UK, mark your calendars & come see us. Swipe for event details. Link for tickets in profile. 🖤
Lately on Black Heart Society…  If you’d like to join, you can find the subscribe button in my profile! 🖤

The Last Legacy is out in paperback today, which means that if you haven’t yet read Tides, the first Narrows novella, the time has come! Bryn & the Roth’s are sharing the paperback edition with Paj & Auster & they are one big happy family. I’m also heading to @bookmarksnc later this week to sign copies for those of you who have ordered. If you’d like one, the link is in my profile! 🖤

Back from my summer hibernation & feeling the Leo season energy. 🦁 ☀️ 🌻 I have been working really hard this year on some very cool things & it’s mostly been behind closed doors, out of sight. It’s been a private, personal hunkering down kind of year, but autumn is coming. With it, a new book will be born, Writing With the Soul will flash some new feathers, & I’m heading back to Europe. So I’m scuttling back out into the light to make sure you don’t miss anything. 🖤

The Italian special edition of Fable from @dreamerwhaleboxes is so pretty that it’s got a spot right beside my desk. I love seeing the different iterations of the book as it’s translated into languages all over the world. Thank you @oscarvault for bringing Fable to Italy & if you’re an Italian reader, I hope you love this crew the way that I do. 🖤

The paperback of Spells for Forgetting is out in the US & the UK today! If the book has been on your TBR, it’s waiting for you at your local bookstore just in time for the upcoming spooky season. If you’re in a book club, you can find the book club kit through the link in my profile. 🖤

The preorder gifts for JUNE are here & they are 😍😍😍. If you preorder a signed copy from @bookmarksnc before release, this little wildflower seed packet from the Farrow family’s flower farm will come with it. You can find the link in my profile. 🖤

Ten advanced reader copies of THE UNMAKING OF JUNE FARROW are looking for new homes. 🥰 This story is rooted in the time altering bonds of women—mothers & daughters who do what they have to for each other. If you’d like an ARC, post in your stories today & tell me about a woman who has been a lifeline, source of wisdom, mentor, or who has just inspired you from afar. Be sure to tag me so I see it & remember that private accounts will have to temporarily be made public so I can view. I’ll pick five readers + five Black Heart Society members on Wednesday & send them their very own early copy of JUNE. 🖤
•
Open to international. 🌎

Out today! Return to the Narrows with Willa as she tries her hand at a future on Jeval with a boy she’s trying very hard to not fall in love with. 🙃 Willa is such a dear character to me & this novella was so much fun to write. I hope you love this story as much as I do. Available on ebook platforms today! 🖤

25% off preorders for @barnesandnoble members begins today!! If you’re not already a member, it’s free to join. I have been a Barnes & Noble member for many, many years! The release of The Unmaking of June Farrow is right around the corner, & if you’d like to support this book with a preorder, this is a great way to do it. Link in my stories to order with code PREORDER25 ! 🖤

I have another sneaky little surprise to share for the BN Preorder Extravaganza!!! Swipe & behold the reveal of the Fable & Namesake paperbacks coming this January! YES, those are stained edges 😍 & YES they are for the first printing only! If you preorder from @barnesandnoble by tomorrow, you’ll get them for 25% off with code PREORDER25. This is one pre-order opportunity I do NOT want you to miss if you are a Fable lover because if want those stained edges… once they are gone, they are GONE! Both will hit shelves on January 2nd. Link in my stories to get your copies.

I have something really cool to show you on Friday. Over the last nine months I’ve been working really hard on a lot of cool things & it’ll finally be ready to share with you. If you would have told me three years ago that this is where we’d be, I would have laughed. But the universe has wrought some really lovely twists into my path. 🖤
•
It’s not a new book announcement. 🤣
Finished copies are here & I’m giving you a little tour up in stories. I’m also inviting you to a wee coffee date on Saturday for a reading of the first chapter. We’re getting close, guys! 🖤

Finally pulling back the curtain on Writing With the Soul. ☺️ When I tell you this was all an accident, I’m not kidding. Many of you know that I started a writers workshop in 2021 that I’ve largely kept out of sight here on my IG & that’s for a couple of reasons: First, it grew way faster & bigger than I ever imagined which low key scared the shit out of me. Since launching, every round of the workshop has sold out the same day it opens & one of those enrollments literally broke my website which was very, um, stressful. Second, this space is really dedicated to my books. That second part is staying the same—my IG won’t start sharing space with WWTS but after three years of answering DMs from people trying to find out more info about WWTS, I finally gave it a home online. Writingwiththesoul.com is now live & (almost) all of her secrets are out! This little pandemic-born workshop has evolved into something really beautiful & something I’m really proud to have put my creative energy into. What was once just a four week workshop is now a collective of writers from over 22 countries connecting through online communities, retreats, research trips, mentorship, virtual events, query camp… the list goes on. & there’s a couple of big things still under wraps, including a collaboration I’m really excited about. Now a TON of those writers are starting their careers & you’ll start seeing more & more of their books on shelves. Over the last 3 years, I somehow stumbled into being an entrepreneur, which is a bigger surprise to me, than anyone. I’ve had to dive into the deep end, learning many things I didn’t ever think I could do & really challenging my own self limiting beliefs. I could talk for a very long time about why this experience has been so empowering. It’s made me really passionate about seeing other women (especially authors!) build other financial support structures outside of advances & royalties. More on that later… If you’ve been curious about the mysterious WWTS (🤣) now you can get all the info you need on the website. & if you’re a writer who has never heard of WWTS, you can check it out. Enrollment for Round 6 of WWTS is Oct 14 & the link is in my profile.🖤

Aujourd’hui, nous avons l’immense plaisir de vous annoncer la venue d’Adrienne Young en France 😍
Celle-ci sera en dédicace à la Fnac des Ternes le samedi 7 octobre de 15h à 17h ! Pour vous inscrire, rendez-vous sur le site de l’Eclaireur Fnac le mercredi 20 septembre à 10h30 !!!
Vous pourrez également la rencontrer à Rennes dans la librairie Le Failler, le lundi 9 octobre de 16h30 à 18h30. Les inscriptions sont déjà ouvertes et vous pouvez retrouver le lien dans notre bio !
SI vous avez des questions, n’hésitez pas à les poser en commentaire ! @fnac_officiel #booksbooksbooks #dedicaces #youngadultbooks #fable

Research, Ireland & a starred review… I’m in Ireland doing some research for a future project at the start of a whirlwind few weeks in Europe & the inspiration is stirring. In 3 1/2 weeks The Unmaking if June Farrow releases & that has me reflecting on a lot of things. This book has been getting a lot of love from early reviewers, including a starred review from Booklist, & I find myself in a surreal kind of daze watching this book come into the world. There will always be people who don’t fall in love with your books, but to see people really resonate with something you written never gets old. That writer/reader connection is magical & I really can’t wait for this book to be out. 🖤

A peek at my inspiration for Jasper, North Carolina, the town in The Unmaking of June Farrow. I spent a lot of time in Marshall, NC, when I was working on this book, including staying at a farm while I penned the first few chapters. The little town sits on the French Broad River & is full of rolling green farmlands. The first time I visited, I was already painting its scenes in my mind. On October 17th you’ll be able to visit Japser yourself. Just keep an eye out for those red doors. 🖤
•
JUNE is up for preorder now. Snag your copy via link in my profile!!
Te amo, España. Can’t wait to come back. 🖤

3  W E E K S  until you meet the Farrow women! A daughter facing a dark fate, a mother carrying a cursed secret, & a grandmother keeping a harrowing promise. There is no limit to what these three women will do for each other. Preorder your copy now through the link in my profile. 🖤

I don’t always feel like I built this house, but I live in it. The inspiration for the story in JUNE reflects one of the most meaningful evolutions I’ve gone through thus far in life (with many more to come, I hope!) & it’s really personal for me. I’m 38 years old, which means I’ve begun to figure out by now that throughout the passing of time, we evolve in a way that makes it seem at times as if we are becoming very different people than we once were. But the thing is, we have to live with the choices we’ve made as our previous self. Finding the space where your new self can embrace the life your old self built for you is where true growth & magic lies. It has been a very rewarding journey for me to own & embrace my life, even as I’m changing, & I find that it makes me appreciate & cherish that life more than ever. This will only make sense to people who have gone through it, but if that’s you, I really do see you. It’s a strange & wonderful reality & when you read JUNE, I hope you feel like that part of you is seen. 🖤

I have something very fun to give you. I’ve got my tea, a rainy day, & the Scottish countryside out my window, but we are just a little more than two weeks away from the release of The Unmaking of June Farrow. To celebrate, @barnesandnoble gave me a little treat to share with my readers: a preorder code just for JUNE! I feel like a little book goblin handing out treasure. 👹 Anyone who preorders through Barnes & Noble using the code BIRDIE25 will get 25% off the cost of the book, which is just very, very cool? Like… anyone can use it? Like… I get to just hand it out like candy? 🤣 The link is in my stories & profile so go forth & preorder as an offering to the book gods! May they bestow their favor upon us. 🖤
•
p.s. thank you Barnes & Noble!

If you want to come celebrate The Unmaking of June Farrow with me in person I have two events coming up! I’ll be at @bookmarksnc with @michelles_library October 17th (this event is already sold out but please sign up on the waitlist if you want to join so we can try to accommodate everyone!) & then I’ll be at @malapropsbookstore October 23rd with my friend @meganshepherdauthor to also celebrate her new book The Midnight Showing! The link to info for both events is in my profile & I hope you can join us!! 🖤

Last day in London, but dropping a reminder that signed & personalized copies of JUNE are available for not much longer from @bookmarksnc ! The link is in my profile to order & copies will ship out with the preorder gift—a packet of wildflower seeds from Adaline River Flower Farm. 🖤

A @barnesandnoble love story… Barnes & Noble holds a very special place in my heart (swipe for memory lane!) because it was the hiding place I ran to in pursuit of a very big dream. There were many, many days after my kids were tucked into bed, that I would race to Barnes & Noble to write in the cafe until after close. I’d grab a coffee, get set up, & type as many words as my fingers could handle as the store slowly fell quiet, the doors got locked, & the employees mopped beneath my feet until they had to kick me out. I wrote a very large portion of my first published book in @bnroseville & when my hands needed a break or I was feeling stuck, I would walk the aisles (sometimes with tears) & imagine my own book on the shelves. I had my debut book launch there & it was my first stop on release day when I had to go see with my very own eyes that YES, this was really, finally happening. Barnes & Noble has been a faithful supporter of my books & they’ve shown up once again for The Unmaking of June Farrow by giving ALL Barnes & Noble preorders of the book 25% off with code BIRDIE25. If you haven’t yet preordered, click the link in my bio & thank you BN for being such a big part of my journey. 🖤

O N E.  W E E K. 🖤

Happy pub day to The Unmaking of June Farrow, a story about choice & choosing, about women & blood ties, about motherhood & the many lives we live from birth to death. I feel proud of all of my books, but no more than this one. I had to scrape the soul from my body to write it & I came out the other side a stronger storyteller. I hope you get lost in its pages & that you feel some feelings along the way. 🖤

“This changes everything.”
The Unmaking of June Farrow is out now. 🖤

The Unmaking of June Farrow is dedicated to two of the only people on this planet I would walk through the red door for. They aren’t really ones for public displays, so I’ll share a few favorite pictures here & sum it up by saying that these two humans have saved me in more ways than I can count & have loved & supported me *unconditionally* for the last 23 years of my life. What a rare gift. I feel eternally grateful for the day I walked into journalism class a lonely, depressed teenager & found them. I’m even more grateful for the fact that I’ve been able to hold onto them all these years & I intend to do just that for the rest of my life. We’ve had many adventures, some of them quite questionable now that I look back, 🤣 & they are still the only people I would run to if my entire world came crashing down. I love you @meghansolo1 & @watsonk24 .🖤
Heart explosions. 🖤

Coming down from a couple of whirlwind weeks. Launching a book is always a very exhausting process, but it’s also really fun to see a story finally get out into the world, on the bookstore shelves, & finding homes in their libraries. Now it’s back to work with words to write, to do lists to conquer & projects to tie up before I head to @yallfest next weekend. If you’ll be there, you can find my schedule by swiping left. I also just recorded a bunch of content for Black Heart Society that will be posting over the next several weeks. If you’re a subscriber, be on the lookout for that. Oh! & the newsletter goes out tomorrow! Link in my profile to subscribe. 🖤

Out at the cabin with friends (& Junie!) to write & break story before we all head to @yallfest this weekend but I wanted to take a moment to thank readers who’ve taken the time to rate & review The Unmaking of June Farrow online. Leaving 🌟 for books on Goodreads or book retailer websites helps them get discovered by new readers. If you’ve recommended June to a friend, picked it for your book club, or have spread the word in any other way, thank you! 🖤

A very, very lovely weekend at @yallfest . Thank you so much for coming out, standing in the rain, & celebrating books with us! This is my favorite festival & my creative heart needed the jolt of hanging with readers, conversations with writers, & laughing until I cried over a box of pizza on the hotel room floor. 🖤

The Unmaking of June Farrow is a Goodreads Choice Awards Nominee in the Fantasy category & I’m very, very grateful to the readers who put her there. Thank you for supporting this story about a family of strange women & their lives on both sides of the red door. 🥰 If you’d like to vote, you can find the link in my profile & stories. 🖤

For the first time in quite a while, I’m feeling hopeful & happy about the turn of the year. The last two have been marked by a lot of internal shifting which has been needed, but I’m ready for my soul to settle, my nervous system to calm, & my movement in the world to find less friction. I’m shedding some old skins & letting some things go, but I’m also stepping into 2024 with more kindness to myself, more gratitude for the love that surrounds me & more appetite to dream. I am wishing the same for all the humans I share this very magical world with. 🖤

Fable & Namesake are out in paperback today! The story that changed everything for me. The books are really beautiful, with magical foiled titling & sprayed edges on the special editions that are available everywhere for the first printing only. If you want them, get them before they’re gone! Links are in my profile. 🖤

Five years ago I was finally able to get the help I needed to heal from severe, debilitating anxiety that had robbed me of my life. That word—anxiety—gets thrown around casually a lot these days, but for some it feels like life or death. It dictates every moment of every day. As a teen, I was told I was dramatic. As a young adult, I was told that prayer & faith would heal me. It wasn’t until I found the right doctors & therapists that I began to find my way out of the labyrinth. If you’re still trapped in the dark, you’re not alone. You’re not crazy. There is a whole life on the other side of your pain & I hope this is the year that everything changes. 🖤

My next adult novel (nicknamed OWL) is inspired by my experience being a twin. I shared the womb with my brother Adam, & the older I get the more I understand what a unique existence it is to navigate childhood & adulthood as a twin. All of my books are deeply personal in some way, like little time capsules of my life & perspective. The OWL book is definitely a reflection of this aspect of my identity, but it’s also a meditation on what it’s like to truly *know* your family, accept how they change & reconcile the differences between the reality you create & the one that actually exists. It’s been a really fun one to work on & I’m really excited to share the title & description with you soon! 🖤

Sharing my 2024 intentions & goals up in my stories today. I know sometimes they get a bad wrap at the new year, but I really enjoy looking ahead, taking stock & dreaming of the year’s potential in a way that doesn’t feel heavy or unrealistic. My first week of 2024 definitely held the energy of the new year I’ve been feeling & while I know there will bumps along the road, I’m believing it will lead somewhere good. 🖤

It’s that time of year when book clubs are voting on their 2024 picks & if yours is reading June Farrow, there’s a handy dandy book club kit just for you. 🥰 You can find the complete kit that includes a letter from me, group discussion questions, the music playlist & even Gran’s biscuit recipe through the link in my profile. 🖤

The very lovely news that The Unmaking of June Farrow is a nominee in @bookofthemonth Book of the Year landed in my inbox yesterday. ☺️ It has been amazing to see this book find its readers & I’m so happy it has had the chance to connect with them through the BOTM community. If you’re a member you can go cast your vote for June through the link in my profile. 🖤

Something new here on the ‘gram. 🌿 Today up in my stories I am collecting a list of “big questions”. Throughout 2024, I’ll be periodically choosing questions from this list that don’t fall into a typical AMA structure. These questions can be about anything really, but will require deeper reflection, more meaningful responses, & align with themes & topics I’m passionate about. My hope is that by the end of the year I’ve had the opportunity to have more meaningful conversations in this space that resonate with who I am & how I’m growing. If you want to be a part of the conversation, head up to my stories to drop your question (don’t post it below!) in the box. All questions will stay anonymous, with a focus on most asked/most in tune with where I’m at & where I’m going. 🖤

Sometimes it feels like I just started this gig & sometimes it feels like an eternity. I’m revising what will be my ninth published novel & because of the story’s themes, my head has been swimming with childhood memories. The first time I ever thought to myself, “I want to write books one day.” was in elementary school. I’d been asked to leave my classroom for defiant behavior (not an uncommon occurrence 🤣) & I was sent to the library so I could be someone else’s problem. But the librarian, even if she didn’t like me much either, left me to my own devices for the most part & I would walk up and down the aisles of books looking at all the covers & reading the jacket copy. I vividly remember running my fingers over the embossed letters of an author’s name, imagining my own there. Thirty years later, my books are in countless libraries across the country. Life is wild. 🖤
New York Times & International Bestselling Author • The Unmaking of June Farrow • Spells For Forgetting • Fable Series • Sky & Sea 🖤
